oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Yellow Fever Encampment
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Diseases; Camps; Yellow fever
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: During the 1878 Yellow Fever, refugee camps were set up outside of Memphis' city limits. Uninfected people were removed to them where they lived in tents. Camp Father Matthew was the Catholic encampment, and the Brothers attended Mass there on Sundays. For the duration of the epidemic the Brothers themselves lived in a house to the south and east of Memphis near Pigeon Roost Road (now known as Lamar).
